attributes.action: Make all school "Keep Clear" markings mandatory zones instead of advisory.
attributes.background: Too many people ignore the Keep Clear markings around school entrances as currently they are advisory unless accompanied by signage and enforced by the local Councils. Making them compulsory No Parking zones would make school entrances safer for all.

attributes.action: More funding for a cure for patients suffering with IBD
attributes.background: The two main forms of inflammatory bowel disease are Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis. Both are chronic diseases that cause inflammation of the digestive system. As well as these intestinal problems, the disease may be associated with abnormalities of the joints, eyes, liver and skin.
attributes.additional_details: Crohn’s disease is the inflammation of the digestive system which leads to diarrhoea, abdominal pain, tiredness and weight loss. Ulcerative colitis is a lifelong disease that is associated with significant morbidity. With Ulcerative Colitis being the most common of the two most patients are diagnosed under the age of 25. Having the start of our lives filled with doctors appointments, hospital apppointments, to be used on clinical trials for drugs that can only surpress and not cure our illness.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on whether or not we have a transitional deal from March 2019.
attributes.background: Ask that the Government now give the British people a referendum on whether or not we have a transitional deal from March 2019. If the vote is no, then there must be no transitional deal, and we must be out of the single market, the customs union and the rulings of EU courts from March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: There are more Remain supporting MPs than Leave supporting MPs. Parliament cannot be trusted. The Government now seems intent on making a transitional deal from March 2019 and giving the EU large sums of UK taxpayers` money from that date. The period from June 2016 to March 2019 should be considered sufficient for everyone to adapt to a full break from the EU in March 2019.

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.
https://food.ndtv.com/opinions/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarket-boycott-as-milk-price-falls-1204828
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/aug/06/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarkets-boycott-as-milk-price-falls
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/price-of-milk-to-go-up-after-dairy-closures-tr220h3sr

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools/colleges to start lessons before 10AM
attributes.background: Child sleep disorders in the uk are on the rise. More and more children are developing mental health issues and their attitude, attendance and grades are getting worse. All because of one thing. School starting early. Most schools in the uk start their lessons around 8:30 and this is way too early.

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to have a free NHS flu jab from September 2018 onwards
attributes.background: Many people considered 'at risk' are fortunate enough to be vaccinated for free, however not everybody is. The recent outbreak has caused lots of people to suffer and even more strain on the NHS. It is counterproductive to deny the flu jab to 'healthy' people as we are not invincible and do get flu.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to pay to have the jab at a pharmacy, but they are not all equal. Some are better than others.

'For otherwise healthy people, flu can be very unpleasant.' - NHS Choices. They acknowledge this is the case for those deemed not to be at risk, yet still do not offer us protection. 

'The surge sparked fresh pleas from doctors for the millions of people who have not had the winter flu jab, including those at particular risk from the virus, to get immunised urgently.' - The Guardian

attributes.action: Ban Admin Fees on Insurance Policies for Legal Need to report Change of Address
attributes.background: When people move house and need to report a legal change to their address circumstances, this should NOT be subjected to punitive fees by profiteering or hidden smallprint in contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Most insurance companies now deliver documents via PDF electronically. This no longer costs them postage. A change of address is a legal requirement (along with Driving Licence and DVLA registration) Charging people a punitive administration fee for complying with the LAW only encourages people to break the law until a policy renews. Simple address changes should be exempt from these Fees irrespective of refunds/increases in policy calculations.

attributes.action: Ban Cryptocurrency
attributes.background: Cryptocurrency such as Bitcoin is a payment method that is used in Dark Web to make make payments for criminal transactions such as fake notes, passports and even drugs. This need to be banned to clean up our society so that no criminal activity using this payment method takes place in the UK.

attributes.action: Changing a man's name after marriage.
attributes.background: Currently in the UK men are unable to use a marriage certificate as proof to change their name when taking their wife's last name. However woman are allowed to use a marriage certificate as proof to take the mans name. A man has to change his name by deed poll, a woman does not.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe in equality and for that reason a marriage certificate should be proof enough to change your name even if you are a man taking your wife's name, or a man taking your husband's name. 

Lets break the tradition and make a change.

attributes.action: Reform the UK prison system by adopting a more rehabilitative approach.
attributes.background: The UK prison system is failing. It does not meet the aims of punishment or prevention and doesn't even act as a deterrent as 47% of people leaving prison reoffend within a year (70% for those U18). This needs to change and we propose the change can come from more actively rehabilitating offenders..
attributes.additional_details: Rehabilitating offenders equips them with skills necessary to enter the world of employment. 50% of offenders have a reading age below 11 and 82% have a writing age below 11. To manage everyday tasks people need a reading age above 11 and so once offenders serve their sentence, they re-enter society with the same lack of skills they entered with. This means that they are likely to get involved with things that led them to prison in the first place, resulting in reoffending. Things must change!

attributes.action: UK residents with ILR to access EU passport or fast track queues at UK Borders
attributes.background: UK residents lose considerable time and productivity to long queues at UK Borders. A registered traveller scheme exists for frequent non-resident visitors from several countries to access faster clearance at the Border. A similar system should be implemented free of charge for residents with ILR.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/registered-traveller/eligibility

attributes.action: pay state pensions into pensioners bank accounts on the day they are due
attributes.background: if your state pension is due on say the 15th it should be in the pensinors account on the 15th  not up to 15 days later
attributes.additional_details: my state pension is allways received 5-10 days late and the pension centre say this is normal?

attributes.action: Restore expatriate Pensioners in Spain their Winter Fuel Allowance.
attributes.background: Expat Pensioners have paid into the system and require parity with Pensioners in the UK. If it is right for UK residents it must be right for Spanish expatriates to receive their allowance.
attributes.additional_details: When the temperatures drop in winter, as they do in the UK, pensioners in Spain need to burn wood to keep their homes warm - homes that have been designed to remain cold in summer become very cold in winter. A great many pensioners are not wealthy but just about surviving on their meagre pension income. The seasonal temperature variation can be as much as 50 + centrigade with the temperatures falling below 0 degrees centigrade when the Sun sets in the Winter season.

attributes.action: Create a new criminal offence. Use of a vehicle to threaten or intimidate.
attributes.background: More and more often people use their vehicle as a weapon toward other, more vulnerable road users. That could be a car driver toward a cyclist or pedestrian, or indeed a cyclist toward a pedestrian. The intentional close pass and other bullying is something that simply cannot be accepted on the road

attributes.action: A fine to those who fail to intervene on a bully.
attributes.background: I am a parent to two happy teenagers and a pre-school educator to lovely pre-school children. I would hate it if anything bad happened to them. I would really love it if bullying was something of the past. I would like to help those who are vulnerable out there.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen many social media videos with children/teenagers being punched/kicked by bullies, and people passing by and not getting involved or stopping them. I would like people to intervene and help those who need help until parents or help arrives. Those who ignore it should be fined. It’s not only our (teacher's) duty to help vulnerable children out there. It should be everyone's out there (mum, dad, grandma/dad, aunties and uncles). Everyone should help.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of money that a person signed off work on sick pay receives.
attributes.background: I'm currently receiving sick pay of £360 a month, due to being hit by a car off my motorcycle by a car driver resulting in breaking my shoulder. The £360 a month that i receive soon disappears due to bills and it's very hard to live off of this amount of money a month, when i physically cannot work.
attributes.additional_details: I'm creating this petition to help others in my situation, who physically cannot work due to a motor vehicle accident. Crashes, accidents and injuries sometimes cannot be helped, if you've been injured from the same case to mine or one similar, why should the injured party suffer due to carelessness of another person? It's certainly not fair that the injured party has to live off of £360 a month when the other person can go back to work and earn their standard living wages a month.

attributes.action: Make Mental health check ups free and compulsory yearly for anyone
attributes.background: Mental health is stigmatised so not enough people are getting the help they need by reaching out. So many people have died because of this. I want to make it compulsory to have a yearly mental health check up so everyone can get the support that they deserve.

attributes.action: Make the Tax-Free Childcare service more transparent for Childcare Providers
attributes.background: There is a complete lack of communication about payments that have been made through Tax-Free Childcare. Providers have an account they can login to, but cannot see any payments that have been made to them.
attributes.additional_details: We rely on parents telling us they have made a payment, and then have to wait until the money is credited to our bank account which can take several working days. We do not get any notification about when a payment is made, and if we call the helpline we are told that information cannot be shared about any pending payments due to data protection. Even on our bank statements, it does not say who the payment has come from. We cannot operate a business like this.

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Create a devolved parliament for the county of Devon
attributes.background: Devon has for too long been put at the bottom of the agenda by the out-of-touch Government in Westminster. We have received far too little in the way of funding for education and the NHS. A devolved assembly would allow us to decide on issues like tax, agriculture housing and education.
attributes.additional_details: The Government at Westminster has for too long now shown a complete lack of regard for The South West and Devon in particular. And despite promises, our hospitals, schools and infrastructure has been underfunded and it is making the people of Devon frustrated. Our pupils are underfunded, local hospitals are being forced to close and our railway system is dreadful, with projects planned before WWII that still haven't been completed. We want a more prosperous Devon inside a fairer united Kingdom.

attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Ensure Cricket Test Matches played by England are on Terrestrial TV.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State should amend the Group B list of events to include Cricket Test Matches played by England, instead of “in England”.
attributes.additional_details: It always used to be the case that sporting events of national significance had to be shown in some form (live or substantial highlights) on terrestrial television. For the first time BT has a monopoly on both live and highlight packages of the Ashes.

attributes.action: Make Falconry in the UK licensed.
attributes.background:
Here in the UK, we are one of the only countries in the world, that does not have a falconry license.
There is a huge issue where anyone can own and breed and sell birds of prey, to people who have no experience. 
I encounter 10-12 owls and Hawks each year kept in parrot cages and rabbit hutches
attributes.additional_details:
There's 1000s of people who have birds of prey, some of these birds can kill animals up the the size of deer, so effectively they're equivalent to a dangerous weapon. 
There needs to be control on the ownership or at the least, a strict mentoring system.

attributes.action: Reject the ratification of the Unitary Patent treaty by the UK and Scotland
attributes.background: The Unitary Patent contain articles which refers to the supremacy of the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU), while politicians have promised to respect the democratic Brexit vote of UK citizens to leave the EU; The UPC court will provide case law in favor of software patents.
attributes.additional_details: For a more complete and lengthy petition, see http://nounitarysoftwarepatents.uk

attributes.action: Stop employers referring to contracted hours employment as a "minimum".
attributes.background: In many contracts, (especially in retail), the hours expected for an employee to work are stated as a "minimum". This wording, in effect, allows the employer to require you to work above your minimum working hours without having to pay you overtime.
attributes.additional_details: The wording of all employment contracts should be absolutely clear as to the expected working hours of the employment. There should be no ambiguity to allow the employer to achieve "free labour" from the technical wording of their contract. If an employer requires an employee to work hours in excess of their contract, this should be reimbursed through overtime payments.

attributes.action: Change laws for British citizenship so they refer to ‘parent’ not ‘father’.
attributes.background:
The right to British citizenship depends on a number factors but sometimes, just the father.

An example is seen here: https://www.gov.uk/register-british-citizen/born-before-2006-british-father.

There is no need for gender at all.

attributes.action: Make all companies share their maternity and paternity leave policies publically
attributes.background: Many companies provide maternity leave pay above the statutory minimum and increasing numbers also offer enhanced paternity pay. These can be invaluable for employees thinking about starting or growing their family but it's often a benefit you can't find out about when you sign up for a new job.
attributes.additional_details:
Making these policies publically available would help working parents make an informed choice about which companies they want to work for and help to celebrate the companies which are the most family friendly. It would also start to bring some parity to an area of benefits which at the moment varys widely from a couple of weeks full pay to a whole year. 

Having a child is one of life's most expensive adventures and choosing an employer who supports this shouldn't be left to chance or hearsay.

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Standardizing the work week to 4 days with a 3 day weekend.
attributes.background:
Increased productivity for business (studies show that employees working a four-day work week are more productive and happier overall); 
Cutting child care issues and costs, health problems from work related stress and an overall healthier work life balance.

attributes.action: Make the uk armed forces pensions tax free.
attributes.background: The current U.K. Armed forces pensions, is taxable, other services are non taxable, this should be addressed and made fair across the public sector.

attributes.action: Legalise a new class of light electric vehicles
attributes.background: Living in a big city, getting around is a major consideration. Public transport is overcrowded, dirty and often inconvenient. Private vehicles are unaffordable and inconvenient. As the UK invests in infrastructure for the alternative, cycling, PEVs which could utilise this continue to be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
As many other countries already do, the UK should embrace the existence of Personal Electric Vehicles (PEVs).

These are small electrically propelled vehicles such as scooters which reach similar speeds to a bicycle with a range of around 20 miles, and unlike bikes are practical enough to be handled like a suitcase when not in use.

With similar regards to electric bikes, legalising PEVs will offer an added green alternative for transportation and allow individuals improved freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: Make basic equality training a legal requirement for businesses
attributes.background: The equality act 2010 is a wonderful piece of legislation that protects people from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: If you've ever been treated unfairly due to your disability, age, race or gender, it is there to protect you but what happens when someone or a company does it and refuses to change? Nothing a lot of the time and it's not right! People and companies need to be educated on the equality act and make reasonable adjustments where necessary.

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Create a scheme that encourages those receiving state benefits to litter pick
attributes.background: As we know from recent media attention, litter is blighting our country and wildlife, and the only way to clear it up is to pick it up. The scheme would not only do this, but also give participants a sense of achievement and responsibility, perhaps encouraged by a reward.
attributes.additional_details: Further consideration should be made for the armed forces, whilst not engaged in military action, to contribute manpower to the scheme.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Require schools to start at 9:30 and end at 3:30.
attributes.background: Children find it extremely difficult to wake up at 7:30 and get to school by 8 or 8:30. Most children hate coming to school because of the time you have to wake up. An extra hour of sleep helps retain information and helps the child perform better at school.
attributes.additional_details: Starting school at 9:30 and ending it at 3:30 gives us 6 hours of education where students are actually awake in lessons because they have had enough time to sleep.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who order goods that are out of stock at the time.
attributes.background: Consumers currently have the right to a refund if unhappy with goods purchased online. They should have the same right when purchasing goods in a shop where the goods are out of stock at time of purchase; as with an Internet purchase, the consumer can't inspect the goods until they actually arrive.
attributes.additional_details: In the face-to-face scenario, it can happen that the goods are out of stock, the trader asks for payment prior to ordering the goods into stock, the trader receives the goods into stock, the consumer inspects the goods but is unhappy with them, then the trader refuses to refund the consumer’s money, forcing the consumer to either accept the goods or alternatively a credit note that may be of no use to the consumer.  I believe that consumers should have the right to a refund in this situation.

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: The UK Government should provide financial aid solutions for future pilots
attributes.background: A major factor driving fewer people to take up the career is the cost of training. Aspiring pilots, who aren’t able to secure a place on the limited number of airline sponsored training schemes, need to find large sums of money to pay for their own training costs which can be upwards of £100,000.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/d7117f1e-d963-11e5-a72f-1e7744c66818

http://www.fta-global.com/fta-news/pilot-shortage-looms-but-uk-and-european-commercial-pilot-licence-issues-are-down

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/business-42917181/pilot-shortage-who-s-going-to-fly-our-planes

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-11691204

http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/articles/35126/balpa-warns-of-uk-pilot-shortage

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Legal Protection for children under age of 16 sending images to sexual predators
attributes.background: Police are threatening to charge children for creating and disturbing child pornography when sending images of themselves to sexual predators thats grooming real children.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are now not willing to report online child sexual exploitation crimes because of fears teens will be arrested. Currently only chikdren under the age of 13 is protected from Child porn crimes when images are off themselves. 

Why should our children face charges because someone groomed them into sending images.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Increase the number of GCSE options that schools offer
attributes.background: The choices we have for GCSE's can be very limited within schools. In my GCSE choices I only had nine other options, other than the core few. This has limited my possible learning and perhaps my future.
attributes.additional_details: The choices you have limit what is possible in the future for me and others with limited choices.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.businessinsider.com/why-norways-prison-system-is-so-successful-2014-12?international=true&r=US&IR=T 

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: Reverse central government funding cuts to councils
attributes.background: Since 2010 central government has cut the funding to councils. It is planned that by 2020 funding by central government to councils will be reduced by 77%. Causing councils to have to make MORE devastating cuts to much needed services including social care, childrens services, education, and more.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the austerity cuts councils have had to make savings, and that has led to a spiraling funding problem, causing the most vulnerable to suffer, social services at crisis point, our roads in dire need of need repair and our children services and early years cut and cut again causing generational damage. It is time to realise that the decision of 2010 by Conservative/Lib Dem government is causing untold damage to the UK, and it needs to be reversed. Put the funding back into our councils.
